Comedy, starring Robin Williams, Michael Gambon, Joan Cusack and Donald O'Connor.

programme.title: Throne of Elves
programme.desc: In the mythical realm of Altera, young hero Lambert is drawn into a bitter conflict between elf princess Liya and her malevolent rival, Elena. Epic animated fantasy, featuring the voices of Ashley Boettcher and GK Bowes.

programme.title: Planes
programme.desc: A crop duster longs to be a racing plane, but is hamstrung by a fear of heights. With the aid of a veteran flyer, he learns to conquer his phobia and compete against some of the world's greatest flyers in a round-the-world race. Animated adventure spin-off from Pixar's Cars, with the voices of Dane Cook, Teri Hatcher and Stacy Keach.

programme.title: Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie
programme.desc: A pair of elementary school pranksters inadvertently transform their mean-spirited principal into a daring vigilante. Cartoon adventure, with the voices of Kevin Hart, Thomas Middleditch and Ed Helms.

programme.title: The Lego Batman Movie
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader swings into action to save Gotham City from the Joker. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Will Arnett, Michael Cera, Rosario Dawson, Ralph Fiennes and Zach Galifianakis.

programme.title: Monster Family
programme.desc: A young family cursed by a witch and transformed into monsters. Animated comedy, with the voices of Emily Watson, Jason Isaacs and Nick Frost.

programme.title: Planes
programme.desc: A crop duster longs to be a racing plane, but is hamstrung by a fear of heights. With the aid of a veteran flyer, he learns to conquer his phobia and compete against some of the world's greatest flyers in a round-the-world race. Animated adventure spin-off from Pixar's Cars, with the voices of Dane Cook, Teri Hatcher and Stacy Keach.

programme.title: The Nut Job 2: Nutty By Nature
programme.desc: Surly the squirrel must save the day when a property-developing mayor threatens his city park home. Animated sequel, with the voices of Will Arnett and Jackie Chan.

programme.title: Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie
programme.desc: A pair of elementary school pranksters inadvertently transform their mean-spirited principal into a daring vigilante. Cartoon adventure, with the voices of Kevin Hart, Thomas Middleditch and Ed Helms.

programme.title: The Lego Batman Movie
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader swings into action to save Gotham City from the Joker. Animated comedy, featuring the voices of Will Arnett, Michael Cera, Rosario Dawson, Ralph Fiennes and Zach Galifianakis.

programme.title: The Incredibles
programme.desc: A superhero couple facing litigation from a disgruntled public have to swap fighting crime for dreary suburban normality. Bored and frustrated, the husband signs up for a mysterious assignment on a remote island - unaware he is jumping straight into a trap that will require his wife and children to wield all their powers to save him. Pixar's animated adventure, with the voices of Craig T Nelson, Holly Hunter, Jason Lee and Samuel L Jackson.

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: The lost princess from the executed Russian royal family returns to her St Petersburg home with no memory of her heritage. As she tries to retrace her hidden past, two conmen use her in a cunning money-making scheme, little realising the momentous events their duplicity is about to set in motion. Animated adventure, with the voices of Meg Ryan, John Cusack and Kelsey Grammer.

programme.title: The Ant Bully
programme.desc: A friendless, moody 10-year-old spends his free time terrorising ants - until the tiny creatures take their revenge by magically reducing him to their own size and forcing him to learn how to contribute to colony life. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Julia Roberts, Nicolas Cage, Meryl Streep and Paul Giamatti.

programme.title: Hercules
programme.desc: The son of Zeus, king of the Greek gods, is sent to Earth to be raised as a human. When he learns of his immortal heritage, he discovers he can only reclaim his position among the gods by becoming a true hero, so he embarks on a series of adventures and battles fearsome monsters to prove his worth. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Tate Donovan, Danny DeVito, James Woods and Rip Torn.(n)

programme.title: The Nut Job 2: Nutty By Nature
programme.desc: Surly the squirrel must save the day when a property-developing mayor threatens his city park home. Animated sequel, with the voices of Will Arnett and Jackie Chan.(n)

programme.title: The Incredibles
programme.desc: A superhero couple facing litigation from a disgruntled public have to swap fighting crime for dreary suburban normality. Bored and frustrated, the husband signs up for a mysterious assignment on a remote island - unaware he is jumping straight into a trap that will require his wife and children to wield all their powers to save him. Pixar's animated adventure, with the voices of Craig T Nelson, Holly Hunter, Jason Lee and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Presto
programme.desc: Animated short comedy from Pixar about a magician preparing for a performance who once again forgets to feed his rabbit before going on stage. However, the animal has had enough of going hungry and plots to ruin the show. Directed and voiced by Doug Sweetland.(n)

programme.title: Hop
programme.desc: The Easter bunny's son is about to take over the chocolate-delivering business, but rejects his responsibilities and heads for Hollywood to seek fame and fortune as a drummer. He makes life difficult for the directionless slacker who takes him in, but they must work together to avert a crisis on Easter island. Part-animated comedy, starring James Marsden, with the voice of Russell Brand.(n)

programme.title: The Emoji Movie
programme.desc: In a world of living ideograms, multi-expressional emoji Gene embarks on a daring mission to find notorious hacker Jailbreak. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of TJ Miller, James Corden and Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Smurfs: The Lost Village
programme.desc: A mysterious map sends Smurfette, Brainy, Clumsy and Hefty on a quest into the Forbidden Forest. Animated adventure, with the voices of Demi Lovato and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: Despicable Me 3
programme.desc: Dismissed from the Anti-Villain League after botching a mission, Gru sets off to meet his long-lost twin brother. Animated sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell, Kristen Wiig and Trey Parker.(n)

programme.title: Monsters University
programme.desc: Student creatures Mike and Sulley attend university to learn how to be scary, but their rivalry gets them both kicked off the course. The monstrous duo must learn how to work together if they are to realise their dreams of terrifying children. Animated comedy prequel, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal and Helen Mirren.(n)

programme.title: Beauty and the Beast
programme.desc: A bookish woman agrees to take her father's place as prisoner of a fearsome monster living in a castle deep in the forest. She gradually grows to see a gentler, more human side to her hideous host, and comes to realise she may be able to break the curse that turned him into a beast in the first place. Disney animated fantasy, with the voices of Paige O'Hara and Robby Benson.(n)

programme.title: The Emoji Movie
programme.desc: In a world of living ideograms, multi-expressional emoji Gene embarks on a daring mission to find notorious hacker Jailbreak. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of TJ Miller, James Corden and Patrick Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Despicable Me 3
programme.desc: Dismissed from the Anti-Villain League after botching a mission, Gru sets off to meet his long-lost twin brother. Animated sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell, Kristen Wiig and Trey Parker.(n)

programme.title: Monsters University
programme.desc: Student creatures Mike and Sulley attend university to learn how to be scary, but their rivalry gets them both kicked off the course. The monstrous duo must learn how to work together if they are to realise their dreams of terrifying children. Animated comedy prequel, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal and Helen Mirren.(n)

programme.title: The Swan Princess
programme.desc: A prince and princess have been expected to marry each other all their lives, a prospect they dreaded as children but which they came to look forward to as adults. However, an evil wizard captures the princess and turns her into a swan. Everyone else believes she is dead, but her betrothed sets out to bring her home. Animated adventure, with the voices of Michelle Nicastro, Jack Palance and John Cleese.(n)

programme.title: Hop
programme.desc: The Easter bunny's son is about to take over the chocolate-delivering business, but rejects his responsibilities and heads for Hollywood to seek fame and fortune as a drummer. He makes life difficult for the directionless slacker who takes him in, but they must work together to avert a crisis on Easter island. Part-animated comedy, starring James Marsden, with the voice of Russell Brand.(n)

programme.title: Hannibal
programme.desc: Fugitive serial killer Dr Hannibal Lecter has gone into hiding as an academic in Italy, but a disfigured victim is determined to find him and inflict a gruesome revenge. FBI agent Clarice Starling is once again drawn into the doctor's deadly orbit as she finds herself being used as bait for the avenger's trap. Ridley Scott's thriller sequel, starring Anthony Hopkins, Julianne Moore, Gary Oldman and Ray Liotta.

programme.title: Wild Things
programme.desc: A high-school counsellor is accused of rape by a student whose advances he spurned - and unfortunately for him, one of her peers backs up her story. Thriller, starring Neve Campbell, Denise Richards, Matt Dillon, Kevin Bacon, Theresa Russell, Robert Wagner and Bill Murray.

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.

programme.title: The Infiltrator
programme.desc: During the 1980s, a chameleonic US agent faces one of the most dangerous assignments of his life when he infiltrates the intricate criminal network of drug kingpin Pablo Escobar. Drama, starring Bryan Cranston, John Leguizamo and Diane Kruger.

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year
programme.desc: The presidential election is approaching, but it remains to be seen whether anti-Purge candidate Charlie Roan can survive the night. Action horror, with Frank Grillo, Mykelti Williamson and Elizabeth Mitchell.

programme.title: The Mexican
programme.desc: A petty crook finds himself in a tricky situation when he tries to smuggle an antique gun from Mexico into America for his Mob boss. As events begin to spiral out of control, his girlfriend's displeasure and a pursuing hitman only add to the would-be bootlegger's woes. Comedy thriller directed by Gore Verbinski, with Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, James Gandolfini, Gene Hackman and JK Simmons.

programme.title: Southern Fury
programme.desc: When his brother falls foul of a ruthless mobster, a straight-laced man calls on his old friend and cop to help out. Crime thriller, starring Adrian Grenier, John Cusack and Nicolas Cage.

programme.title: Gran Torino
programme.desc: Misanthropic Korean War veteran Walt leads an isolated existence, and has a tense relationship with his family and nothing but contempt for his neighbours. When a teenager attempts to steal his prized car, he ends up trying to reform the thief, making a connection with the boy's relatives and defending them from a street gang. Drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Christopher Carley and Bee Vang.

programme.title: Eliminators
programme.desc: A former federal agent in the witness protection programme is forced to come out of hiding and go on the run. Thriller, starring Scott Adkins, Stu Bennett and Daniel Caltagirone.

programme.title: Flightplan
programme.desc: A widow boards a plane with her daughter and promptly falls asleep. When she wakes up, the girl has disappeared - and the mother's fear turns to outright panic when the aircraft crew insists she boarded the flight alone, suggesting the child is merely a figment of her distressed imagination. Thriller, starring Jodie Foster, Peter Sarsgaard, Sean Bean and Greta Scacchi.

programme.title: The Da Vinci Code
programme.desc: A respected academic goes on the run when he is framed for the murder of a French historian. Pursued by the detective on the case and a sinister assassin monk, he strives to unmask the culprit, leading to a conspiracy determined to preserve a 2,000-year-old secret at any cost. Thriller based on Dan Brown's novel, starring Tom Hanks, Audrey Tautou, Ian McKellen, Paul Bettany and Jean Reno.

programme.title: Single White Female
programme.desc: Software designer Allison is looking for a flatmate and seems to have struck lucky with shy applicant Hedra. However, Allison soon comes to realise her new friend is dangerously obsessed with her, and when she plans a reconciliation with her former boyfriend, a jealous Hedra becomes increasingly unhinged. Psychological thriller, with Bridget Fonda, Jennifer Jason Leigh, and Steven Weber.

programme.title: RoboCop
programme.desc: A police officer in a future Detroit ravaged by crime is seemingly killed in the line of duty, but is rebuilt as a law-enforcing cyborg by the corporation that has taken over running the force. He begins to remember his human life and seeks to bring his killers to justice - a mission that leads him to turn on his corrupt corporate masters. Sci-fi thriller, starring Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Ronny Cox and Miguel Ferrer.

programme.title: RoboCop 2
programme.desc: The cybernetic law enforcer returns to battle a deranged drug lord. Meanwhile, he is unaware the corporation that created him has scheduled his replacement by a more powerful version. To complete the new cyborg, they need a human brain, and a renegade scientist secretly implants the injured drug lord's brain into the robot, transforming it into an uncontrollable killing machine. Sci-fi thriller sequel, starring Peter Weller, Nancy Allen, Tom Noonan and Belinda Bauer.

programme.title: Angel Flight Down
programme.desc: A mercy mission runs into difficulty when the plane commissioned to airlift a sick girl suffers engine trouble and crashes on the edge of a cliff. Drama, starring Patricia Kalember and David Charvet.

programme.title: City of Tiny Lights
programme.desc: A hard-drinking private detective searches for a missing sex worker, leading to a dangerous world of religious fanaticism and political intrigue. London-set crime thriller from Dredd director Pete Travis, starring Riz Ahmed, Billie Piper and James Floyd.

programme.title: Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps
programme.desc: Ruthless stockbroker Gordon Gekko is released from prison after eight years, reinventing himself as an author and lecturer warning against the dangers of the financial system. Gekko helps a young banker get revenge on the company that drove his mentor to suicide, but as always, has a crooked agenda of his own. Oliver Stone's sequel to his 1980s drama, with Michael Douglas, Shia LaBeouf and Carey Mulligan.

programme.title: Out of Sight
programme.desc: A charming bank robber breaks out of jail and takes a female US Marshal hostage. Managing to escape, she sets out to track him down as he prepares for one last job - but as the chase intensifies, so do their feelings for each other. Steven Soderbergh's romantic crime drama, based on Elmore Leonard's novel, with George Clooney, Jennifer Lopez, Ving Rhames and Don Cheadle.

programme.title: Baby Driver
programme.desc: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver with tinnitus takes part in a heist doomed to fail. Edgar Wright's music-themed action thriller, starring Ansel Elgort, Kevin Spacey and Jon Hamm.

programme.title: Unforgettable
programme.desc: A woman sets out to make life a living hell for her ex-husband's new fiancee. Thriller, starring Rosario Dawson, Katherine Heigl and Geoff Stults.

programme.title: Road to Perdition
programme.desc: Devoted husband and father Michael Sullivan leads a secret life as a hitman, but faces a crisis when his son witnesses his involvement in a killing. The lad promises to keep his mouth shut, but one of Sullivan's fellow gangsters wipes out the rest of his family - forcing father and son to go on the run together. Sam Mendes' crime drama set in Depression-era Chicago, starring Tom Hanks, Paul Newman, Jude Law, Daniel Craig and Jennifer Jason Leigh.

programme.title: Angels & Demons
programme.desc: Academic adventurer Robert Langdon is called in by the Vatican to deal with a crisis. The Pope has died and the four cardinals in line to be his successor have all been abducted by a mysterious sect that is threatening to murder them. As he searches for the kidnapped clerics, Langdon discovers the cult has an even more horrific plan in mind. Thriller sequel to The Da Vinci Code, with Tom Hanks and Ewan McGregor.

programme.title: Baby Driver
programme.desc: After being coerced into working for a crime boss, a young getaway driver with tinnitus takes part in a heist doomed to fail. Edgar Wright's music-themed action thriller, starring Ansel Elgort, Kevin Spacey and Jon Hamm.

programme.title: Serpico
programme.desc: An idealistic undercover cop in 1960s New York is ostracised by his fellow officers for his refusal to take bribes. Sickened by the widespread corruption in the force and the refusal of his superiors to do anything, he sets out to publicly expose the guilty parties, putting his own life on the line in the process. Fact-based drama directed by Sidney Lumet, starring Al Pacino and John Randolph.

programme.title: Cape Fear
programme.desc: A psychopathic rapist is released from prison after 14 years and plots revenge on the defence attorney he blames for his imprisonment. Subjecting the lawyer and his family to a terrifying campaign of intimidation, he uses his knowledge of the law to stay untouchable. Martin Scorsese's thriller remake, starring Robert De Niro, Nick Nolte, Jessica Lange and Juliette Lewis, with cameo appearances by Gregory Peck, Robert Mitchum and Martin Balsam, who all appeared in the 1962 original.(n)

programme.title: ID2: Shadwell Army
programme.desc: A police officer goes undercover as a football hooligan to bring far-right extremists to justice. Sequel to the 1995 crime thriller, starring Simon Rivers, Linus Roache, Paul Popplewell and Andy Rush.(n)

programme.title: Point Last Seen
programme.desc: The head of a search and rescue team whose children were kidnapped by her ex-husband hunts obsessively for a girl gone missing in the desert. However, her search is interrupted by news that her spouse has been found - but the children he took are nowhere to be found. Fact-based drama, starring Linda Hamilton and Kevin Kilner.(n)

programme.title: Drone
programme.desc: A drone pilot who's spent his career conducting covert operations from the comfort of his own home is finally forced to confront his actions. Thriller, starring Sean Bean, Patrick Sabongui and Mary McCormack.(n)

programme.title: The Hatton Garden Job
programme.desc: A ragtag group of career criminals plot an audacious, multi-million-pound raid on an underground facility in London. True-life crime drama, with Stephen Moyer, Larry Lamb and Matthew Goode.(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A single mother is determined to keep her daughter safe from harm when burglars break into their home. The pair hide out in a specially constructed sealed room, but the shelter becomes a prison when the robbers refuse to leave empty-handed. Thriller directed by David Fincher, starring Jodie Foster, Kristen Stewart, Forest Whitaker, Jared Leto and Dwight Yoakam.(n)

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: FBI agent Gretchen Blair finds herself caught in the middle of an elaborate mid-air heist. Thriller, starring Denise Richards, Dolph Lundgren and Chuck Liddell.(n)

programme.title: President Under Siege
programme.desc: The Belgian prime minister is kidnapped and told that he must assassinate the US president if he ever wants to see his family again. Thriller, starring Adam Godley, Saskia Reeves and Koen De Bouw. In Dutch and English.(n)

programme.title: Freehold
programme.desc: Fast-talking estate agent Hussein finds his personal and professional life unravelling as a wronged former client takes his revenge. Comedy horror, starring Javier Botet, Mandeep Dhillon and Mim Shaikh.(n)

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: A police forensic psychologist searches for the daughter of a senator, who has been kidnapped from her expensive private school by a media-obsessed teacher, sparking a desperate race to hunt down her psychotic and devilishly intelligent captor before it is too late. Thriller prequel to Kiss the Girls, starring Morgan Freeman, Monica Potter, Michael Wincott, Dylan Baker and Penelope Ann Miller.(n)

programme.title: Inferno
programme.desc: Robert Langdon awakes with amnesia in an Italian hospital, and is soon on the run with a beautiful doctor. Racing to stop a devastating virus, the Da Vinci Code expert suffers shocking visions as an assassin closes in. Thriller, starring Tom Hanks, Felicity Jones and Irrfan Khan.(n)

programme.title: Brawl In Cell Block 99
programme.desc: A former boxer is blackmailed into performing a prison hit by a ruthless drug kingpin. Crime thriller, starring Vince Vaughn, Jennifer Carpenter and Don Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Identity
programme.desc: Ten strangers take shelter from a storm in a remote hotel, but start to suspect their being together at the same place and time is more than just a coincidence. Before long a mysterious figure begins to murder them off one by one - leaving the guests to work out which of them is the killer, or if someone else is in the hotel. Murder mystery, starring John Cusack, Ray Liotta, Amanda Peet and Alfred Molina.(n)

programme.title: Savages
programme.desc: Two friends make a living dealing marijuana, but their small enterprise attracts the attention of a Mexican drug cartel. The gangsters kidnap their shared girlfriend and force them to sell their business, so the small-timers turn to a corrupt DEA agent for help in fighting back. Oliver Stone's crime drama, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Taylor Kitsch, Blake Lively, Salma Hayek and Benicio Del Toro.

programme.title: The Far Horizons
programme.desc: In 1803, Meriwether Lewis and William Clark set out to chart the Louisiana Territory, with their trek taking them through the unknown the Pacific Northwest, guided by a Shoshone woman called Sacajawea. Western, starring Fred MacMurray, Charlton Heston, Donna Reed and Barbara Hale.

programme.title: Funeral in Berlin
programme.desc: Former crook and disreputable spy Harry Palmer has to carefully engineer the defection of a Russian officer responsible for safeguarding vital military secrets - but the mission proves less than straightforward. Cold War thriller and the second film to feature Len Deighton's character, starring Michael Caine, Eva Renzi, Oscar Homolka, Paul Hubschmid and Guy Doleman.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Brain
programme.desc: Former secret agent Harry Palmer comes out of retirement to take a mysterious canister to Finland, and ends up embroiled in an American megalomaniac's bid to take over the world. Espionage thriller, directed by Ken Russell and starring Michael Caine, Oscar Homolka and Karl Malden.

programme.title: Carry On Spying
programme.desc: A secret formula is stolen by a sinister organisation masterminded by the evil Dr Crow. The British government plans to assign its top agents to deal with the crisis, but owing to staff shortages, has to settle for a bungling spy and his three hapless trainees. Comedy, starring Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Cribbins, Jim Dale, Eric Barker and Victor Maddern.

programme.title: Top Secret
programme.desc: A rock 'n' roll singer goes on tour in East Germany in the 1950s, where a scientist's daughter draws him into the world of international espionage through a French underground movement seeking to foil a Nazi plan to take over the world. Comedy, spoofing Second World War spy thrillers and Elvis movies, starring Val Kilmer, Lucy Gutteridge and Omar Sharif.

programme.title: The Heat
programme.desc: An uptight, ambitious FBI agent is sent to Boston to bring a notorious drug kingpin to justice. She ends up forced to team up with a rebellious, foul-mouthed local police detective who has a very different attitude to law enforcement but shares her inability to work with others. Action comedy, starring Sandra Bullock and Melissa McCarthy.

programme.title: Kiss the Girls
programme.desc: A forensic psychologist hunts for a serial kidnapper stalking a university campus and responsible for his niece's disappearance. Working out of his jurisdiction, he defies local law enforcement officials to get to the truth - with the aid of one of the criminal's past victims, a headstrong doctor determined to see her former captor brought to justice. Thriller, starring Morgan Freeman, Ashley Judd, Cary Elwes and Tony Goldwyn.

programme.title: Five Deadly Venoms
programme.desc: The dying master of a powerful clan dispatches his last student Yang Tieh on a mission to check on the activities of five former pupils he fears may be using their abilities for evil purposes. However, they are all masters of a specific martial arts style, while Yang Tieh barely has a grounding in each, and they are living under assumed identities in locations unknown. Martial arts adventure, starring Chiang Sheng. In Mandarin.

programme.title: Spy Kids 4: All the Time in the World
programme.desc: A secret agent decides to retire after having a baby, while her two stepchildren remain completely unaware of her exciting past. They stumble on to the truth when she is recalled to duty and, with the aid of two former junior spies, they help battle an evil mastermind who has the power to control time. Family adventure, starring Jessica Alba, Jeremy Piven, Rowan Blanchard and Mason Cook.

programme.title: Spy Interview Special
programme.desc: Melissa McCarthy, Miranda Hart and Jude Law, and Bridesmaids director Paul Feig talk about their new action-comedy Spy, and the art of making funny movies.

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: A gentleman jewel thief's pet orang-utan runs amok in a swanky hotel, causing endless problems for the put-upon manager who has enough on his plate trying to ensure the establishment successfully attains a six-star rating. Family comedy, starring Jason Alexander, Rupert Everett, Faye Dunaway, Eric Lloyd and Paul Reubens.

programme.title: ParaNorman
programme.desc: A misunderstood boy is able to communicate with ghosts haunting his neighbourhood, but no one else believes they exist. When a curse placed on the town by a witch centuries ago causes zombies to rise from the grave, it falls to the youngster to avert disaster. Animated adventure, with the voices of Kodi Smit-McPhee and John Goodman.

programme.title: Epic
programme.desc: A teenager wanders into a forest that her scientist father believes is home to a race of miniature people. She stumbles on the tiny creatures and is shrunk down to their size so she can carry out a quest to save their new queen from an invading army. Animated adventure, with the voices of Amanda Seyfried, Josh Hutcherson, Colin Farrell and Christoph Waltz.

programme.title: Spy Interview Special
programme.desc: Melissa McCarthy, Miranda Hart and Jude Law, and Bridesmaids director Paul Feig talk about their new action-comedy Spy, and the art of making funny movies.

programme.title: The Three Musketeers
programme.desc: A hot-headed swordsman sets off to join the King of France's royal guard, and falls in with a trio of former members who have fallen into disgrace. They join forces to defeat a plot to overthrow the king by an English lord who has built a deadly airship. Swashbuckling adventure, with Logan Lerman, Milla Jovovich, Matthew Macfadyen, Ray Stevenson and Luke Evans.

programme.title: Cell
programme.desc: Premiere. A mysterious signal is transmitted to every mobile phone in the world, causing those who hear it to turn into bloodthirsty maniacs. A writer who was unaffected by the transmission bands together with a few other survivors to track down his family and unlock the mystery behind the crisis. Sci-fi thriller based on Stephen King's novel, starring John Cusack and Samuel L Jackson.

programme.title: Creepshow
programme.desc: George A Romero's horror anthology of five chilling tales paying homage to the cult American EC comics of the 1950s and based on stories by Stephen King, who also makes a cameo appearance. Starring Leslie Nielsen, Carrie Nye and Hal Holbrook.

programme.title: Princess Mononoke
programme.desc: A young man develops a strange infection after an encounter with a demonic creature. As he sets out in search of a cure, he ends up trying to avert a war between the humans of a mining community and the spirits of the natural world, including a mysterious girl who was raised by wolves. Hayao Miyazaki's animated fantasy adventure, with the voices of Yoji Matsuda and Yuriko Ishida. In Japanese.(n)

programme.title: The Rugrats Movie
programme.desc: Tommy tries to return his new brother to the baby shop, helped by Angelica, Chuckie, Phil and Lil - but the friends become lost in dense woodlands en route, turning their expedition into a scary and exciting journey of discovery. Animated comedy based on the TV series, with the voices of Elizabeth Daily, Christine Cavanaugh, Kath Soucie, Whoopi Goldberg and Busta Rhymes.(n)

programme.title: Spy Interview Special
programme.desc: Melissa McCarthy, Miranda Hart and Jude Law, and Bridesmaids director Paul Feig talk about their new action-comedy Spy, and the art of making funny movies.(n)

programme.title: The Rugrats in Paris: The Movie
programme.desc: The lucky little tots embark on a trip to a French theme park - but while the rest of the gang are intent on enjoying themselves, Chuckie is distracted by his wish for a new mum. He sets his sights on the owner of the amusement park as a prospective partner for his single dad. Animated adventure, with the voices of Christine Cavanaugh, Elizabeth Daily, Cheryl Chase, Kath Soucie and Susan Sarandon.(n)

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents' teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc: A father-of-two struggling to cope with the death of his wife is in need of a fresh start, so buys a house with a dilapidated zoo on the grounds. With the help of the keepers, he works to restore the attraction to its former glory, while also trying to reconnect with his troubled teenage son. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church.(n)

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum.(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: A deskbound CIA agent provides valuable background support for a dashing secret agent, but has never gone into action herself. Everything changes, when the spy mysteriously vanishes, and she leaps into action to take his place, infiltrating the inner circle of a ruthless arms dealer and trying to avert a global catastrophe. Comedy adventure, starring Melissa McCarthy, Jason Statham and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: Odd Thomas
programme.desc: A cook has the ability to see ghosts, and is startled to find a stranger in his town has attracted an unusually large number of spirits. He takes this as a sign that this man is going to cause a terrible disaster, so tries to find out what is going to happen and if it can be stopped. Supernatural thriller based on Dean Koontz's novel, starring Anton Yelchin and Willem Dafoe.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A cousin comes to stay with the family, bringing her grandchildren, and becomes determined to make Olivia's life easier.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John cannot find his high school diploma, so is forced to take a test to prove to the army that he graduated. Mary Ellen takes over from the county nurse.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The group goes on a camping trip, but Caroline scratches herself on a piece of baling wire and develops a dangerous infection in her leg. Charles and the other girls are not around to help.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary, Laura and Carl look round a railway wagon at the station, only for it to start moving into the path of an oncoming train.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Jim begins spending time with a friend of Syd's who is also a photo-journalist - but she and Joanie are quick to interfere.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd is upset to learn Jim and Monica have grown closer and Joanie is rescued from a smoke-filled bakery by a handsome fireman. Robbie's streak of good luck on the game show shows no sign of running out as he continues to win huge cash prizes.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan meets the chauvinistic coach of a high-school American football team, and tries to persuade him to allow girls to play.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark come to the aid of an honest politician, whose reputation is being slandered by an unscrupulous rival. Ken Kercheval guest stars.

programme.title: Princess Diana: In Search of Happiness
programme.desc: A review of the life of Diana, Princess of Wales, including her childhood, her move into the public eye, her work for charity, her marriage and her death.

programme.title: Diana, Queen of Hearts
programme.desc: Documentary capturing an unseen side to the princess's life through cameraman Mike Lloyd, who filmed some of her most treasured moments.

programme.title: The War Bride
programme.desc: A cockney seamstress marries a Canadian serviceman after a whirlwind romance in London during the Second World War. She is sent to live with his family on their farm in a backwater of Alberta until the conflict is over, but she struggles to get along with her dour in-laws, who make no attempt to welcome her. Drama, starring Anna Friel, Brenda Fricker, Molly Parker, Loren Dean and Aden Young.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A famous evangelist comes to town, and Olivia hopes the family will let him baptise them. However, John does not approve of the preacher's outlook on religion.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary gives Laura a baby raccoon as a pet, but it bites both her and the family dog, leaving Charles worried it may have rabies.

programme.title: Perry Mason: The Case of the Jealous Jokester
programme.desc: Lawyer Bill McKenzie bends the rules to clear his niece of murdering a TV star who ruled her sitcom with an iron fist. Courtroom drama, starring Hal Holbrook, William R Moses, Barbara Hale and Tony Roberts, with an appearance by real-life sitcom star Tina Yothers.

programme.title: Perry Mason: The Case of the Killer Kiss
programme.desc: Suspects abound in the case of a TV soap star's murder, setting the redoubtable legal eagle on a crusade to separate fact from fiction. All the evidence seems to point in the direction of an old friend, and with a host of witnesses willing to testify against her, Perry has his work cut out. Mystery, featuring Raymond Burr in his last appearance as the ace attorney, with Barbara Hale, William R Moses and Stuart Damon.

programme.title: Gettysburg
programme.desc: Fact-based drama recreating the battle of the American Civil War, where Union and Confederate forces fought for three days in Pennsylvania, a confrontation that would change the course of the war. Starring Tom Berenger, Martin Sheen, Jeff Daniels and Stephen Lang.

programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce.

programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce.

programme.title: Diana, Queen of Hearts
programme.desc: Documentary capturing an unseen side to the princess's life through cameraman Mike Lloyd, who filmed some of her most treasured moments.

programme.title: Happy Days
programme.desc: Potsie organises a date to put a little sparkle into Richie's loveless life, but the lucky girl's reputation leaves a lot to be desired.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia seeks help from the Pickett defence plant for a day nursery for the children of the defence workers, but encounters much difficulty. When Corabeth discovers a perfumed handkerchief in her husband's pocket, she suspects the worst of Ike ruining their anniversary celebrations.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A film crew shoot a documentary at the plant, and the director tells Erin he can make her a star.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: When teacher Miss Beadle is deemed unable to control some of the older boys in her class, Mrs Oleson convinces the school board to replace her with a firmer, male hand. However, the new teacher falsely blames Laura for several problems, and tries to have her thrown out of school when test papers become damaged.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: During a recession, Charles and Mr Edwards take a dangerous job handling highly explosive liquid dynamite.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: A terrible headache leaves Syd experiencing bizarre hallucinations, where she encounters the characters from Alice in Wonderland. Joanie and fireman Burt look forward to a relaxing weekend away together - but find that their hosts at the remote B&B have other plans for them.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Sydney arrives home from hospital, but has doubts about the treatment recommended to her by a handsome new-age physical therapist.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family offers the new minister a place to stay, and Elizabeth falls in love with him. Erin offers to help the Baldwin sisters write their memoirs.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben hatches a money-making scheme his father does not approve of, while Yancy trains to become a barber.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason wrestles with the morality of war as he decides whether to enlist in the army, while Jim Bob is desperate to join up despite being too young.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family takes in an old friend of John Boy's who has been serving in the war, but is now in a wheelchair as a result of his injuries.

programme.title: End of Summer
programme.desc: A Victorian artist struggles to repress her romantic feelings for a wealthy suitor, who responds by embarking on a torrid fling with her 18-year-old ward instead. Drama, starring Jacqueline Bisset, Peter Weller, Julian Sands and Amy Locane.

programme.title: Elvis Presley - The Rock and Roll Years
programme.desc: Exploring The King of Rock and Roll's inside story, including full performances of tracks including Tutti Frutti, Heartbreak Hotel, Hound Dog, Don't Be Cruel and Love Me Tender.

programme.title: Elvis: The Early Years
programme.desc: The first in a two-part biopic of the king of rock 'n' roll, Elvis Presley, charting his humble beginnings in Tupelo, Mississippi, to his recordings at Sun Studios in Memphis and his conscription into the US army. Jonathan Rhys Meyers plays the singer, with Rose McGowan, Camryn Manheim and Randy Quaid.

programme.title: Elvis: The Early Years
programme.desc: Conclusion of the rock 'n' roll biopic, starring Jonathan Rhys Meyers as the much-loved performer. Following his varied film career and the rise of pop music, Elvis stages a comeback, but his reliance on drugs intensifies as the demands of fame take hold. With Rose McGowan and Randy Quaid.

programme.title: Take Me Home: The John Denver Story
programme.desc: Biopic of the country singer, charting his childhood as the son of an overbearing air force officer, his early brush with fame in the Chad Mitchell Trio and his rise to success as a solo artist, despite a string of personal traumas - before his ill-fated flight over Monterey Bay. Starring Chad Lowe, Kristin Davis, Gerald McRaney and Brian Markinson.

programme.title: The Jazz Singer
programme.desc: A Jewish cantor's son goes against his strict father's wishes and travels to Los Angeles in search of fame and fortune. Remake of the 1927 musical drama, starring Neil Diamond in the role originally played by Al Jolson, with Laurence Olivier, Lucie Arnaz and Catlin Adams.

programme.title: Hendrix
programme.desc: Biopic of the legendary guitarist who changed the face of music during the 1960s. Starring Wood Harris, Vivica A Fox, Dorian Harewood and Billy Zane.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John and Olivia make a decision about publishing a manuscript John-Boy wrote while overseas. Meanwhile, Jeffrey becomes very attached to an old dog.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ashley Longworth Jr returns on leave from his ship in the South Pacific, and asks Erin to marry him. The would-be bride accepts, but begins to have doubts when she discovers something unexpected about her future husband.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Caroline and the girls think the worst when Charles begins to behave mysteriously and lies about the amount of time he has spent doing carpentry with an attractive neighbour.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Walnut Grove celebrates the centennial of the United States, but the party is threatened with cancellation when taxes go up - while a Russian immigrant faces losing his home.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: As Hallowe'en approaches, a recovering Syd prescribes a dose that almost kills a girl, making her fear she may have returned to work too soon. To make matters worse, she also suspects her substitute, Dr Roberts, is conspiring to take over the clinic.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: At the request of her handsome physical therapist, Syd encourages a dancer to abandon her dreams for the sake of her health.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia thinks John works too hard and tries to persuade him to take some time off, but then receives disturbing news about her own health.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A stroke of luck saves Jim Bob from certain disaster, and prompts a major change in his outlook on life.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben enters a photo of Erin in a contest, but does not realise what they intend to do with it. Curt's death makes Mary Ellen become over-protective of her son.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Elizabeth has to look after the store after Ike suffers a heart attack, while Ben and Jim Bob go into the molasses business.(n)

programme.title: The Edge of the Garden
programme.desc: A newly single man moves into an abandoned house in the country, where he starts to communicate with a woman who lived there 50 years ago and died in mysterious circumstances. Drama, starring Rob Estes.(n)

programme.title: Take Me Home: The John Denver Story
programme.desc: Biopic of the country singer, charting his childhood as the son of an overbearing air force officer, his early brush with fame in the Chad Mitchell Trio and his rise to success as a solo artist, despite a string of personal traumas - before his ill-fated flight over Monterey Bay. Starring Chad Lowe, Kristin Davis, Gerald McRaney and Brian Markinson.(n)

programme.title: Life Is Not a Fairytale: The Fantasia Barrino Story
programme.desc: The 2004 winner of American Idol plays herself in an account of her struggle to overcome poverty, abuse and illiteracy. Also starring Loretta Devine and Viola Davis.(n)

programme.title: Ring of Fire
programme.desc: The story of the decades-long love affair between June Carter and her husband, Johnny Cash. Romantic drama, starring Jewel Kilcher, Matt Ross and John Doe.(n)

programme.title: In His Life: The John Lennon Story
programme.desc: Biopic of the singer who formed one half of the most successful and celebrated songwriting partnership of modern times. The film charts the musician's youth in Liverpool and his rise to fame with the Beatles, a group which redefined popular music during the 1960s, before recalling his solo career and tragic death outside his home in Manhattan. Starring Philip McQuillan, Blair Brown, Daniel McGowan and Jamie Glover.(n)

programme.title: The Linda McCartney Story
programme.desc: Biopic of the late wife of Paul McCartney. Linda first meets her future husband while working as an aspiring rock photographer at the height of the Fab Four's 1960s fame. Their 30-year marriage is marked by a shared devotion to animal rights activism, but ultimately comes to an end as she battles cancer. Starring Elizabeth Mitchell, Gary Bakewell and David Lewis.(n)

programme.title: Ring of Fire
programme.desc: The story of the decades-long love affair between June Carter and her husband, Johnny Cash. Romantic drama, starring Jewel Kilcher, Matt Ross and John Doe.(n)

programme.desc: The first in a two-part biopic of the king of rock 'n' roll, Elvis Presley, charting his humble beginnings in Tupelo, Mississippi, to his recordings at Sun Studios in Memphis and his conscription into the US army. Jonathan Rhys Meyers plays the singer, with Rose McGowan, Camryn Manheim and Randy Quaid.(n)

programme.title: Elvis: The Early Years
programme.desc: Conclusion of the rock 'n' roll biopic, starring Jonathan Rhys Meyers as the much-loved performer. Following his varied film career and the rise of pop music, Elvis stages a comeback, but his reliance on drugs intensifies as the demands of fame take hold. With Rose McGowan and Randy Quaid.(n)

programme.title: Take Me Home: The John Denver Story
programme.desc: Biopic of the country singer, charting his childhood as the son of an overbearing air force officer, his early brush with fame in the Chad Mitchell Trio and his rise to success as a solo artist, despite a string of personal traumas - before his ill-fated flight over Monterey Bay. Starring Chad Lowe, Kristin Davis, Gerald McRaney and Brian Markinson.(n)

programme.title: The Jazz Singer
programme.desc: A Jewish cantor's son goes against his strict father's wishes and travels to Los Angeles in search of fame and fortune. Remake of the 1927 musical drama, starring Neil Diamond in the role originally played by Al Jolson, with Laurence Olivier, Lucie Arnaz and Catlin Adams.(n)

programme.title: Icebreaker
programme.desc: Axe makes a bold play to secure capital from a controversial source. Taylor chafes against Axe’s recent moves. Chuck recruits the allies he needs to move forward with a new plan. Connerty seeks out a career opportunity.

programme.title: Never Mind
programme.desc: At the Melrose family’s glorious house in the South of France, young Patrick has the run of the magical grounds. His father David rules with cruelty and his mother Eleanor has retreated into self medication and booze. Bravely imaginative and self-sufficient out of necessity, 9-year-old Patrick encounters the volatile lives of adults with fear. They are expecting guests for the weekend, but this afternoon is profoundly unlike other summer days, and the shocking events that precede the guests’ arrival tear Patrick's world in two.

credits.director: Adult Content, Rape, Adult Language, Mild Violence

programme.desc: When the guys forget Steven's birthday, they band together to make it up to him with guns, go-karts and cake sex; Brace introduces Nic to the joys of a colonic.

credits.director: Graphic Language, Adult Content, Nudity, Strong Sexual Content

programme.title: Icebreaker
programme.desc: Axe makes a bold play to secure capital from a controversial source. Taylor chafes against Axe’s recent moves. Chuck recruits the allies he needs to move forward with a new plan. Connerty seeks out a career opportunity.(c)

programme.title: Kevin Smith: Silent But Deadly
programme.desc: Kevin Smith, the filmmaker, is anything but quiet in this new comedy special that was recorded an hour before his widely reported massive heart attack in February. But before he nearly died backstage, he killed onstage discussing his marriage, his kid, his friends and his work (or lack thereof).

programme.title: Single White Female
programme.desc: Hedy (Jennifer Jason Leigh) appears at the apartment of Allie (Bridget Fonda) just as she has thrown out her unfaithful boyfriend (Steven Weber). The surviving half of a set of twins, Hedy perpetually seeks someone to complete her, and sees in Allie everything she would like to be. Hedy moves not only into the apartment, but into the most personal aspects of Allie's life, including having her hair styled exactly to match her roommate's. When Allie reconciles with her boyfriend, the unspoken bargain between the women goes terrifyingly awry.

programme.title: Their Brand is Crisis
programme.desc: The Trump administration has had to contend with an unprecedented number of crises, and spinning them is an ongoing preoccupation. In this era of splintered news media, how do you get the right message to the right people, and still stay on course? Former New Jersey Governor Chris Christie discusses trying to govern during a PR crisis, Steve Brill hosts an Axios event on combatting fake news, and Steve Schmidt and Mark Fabiani, Bill Clinton's advisor during the Whitewater scandal, both weigh in on how this White House is managing crises.(c)

programme.title: Push (2009)
programme.desc: A clairvoyant teenager (Dakota Fanning) and a telekinetic fugitive (Chris Evans) team up to find a missing woman who is the key to exposing a sinister, secret government agency that's building a clandestine army of psychic warriors. Djimon Hounsou costars in this sci-fi action thriller.

programme.title: Wakefield
programme.desc: Successful suburbanite commuter Howard Wakefield (Bryan Cranston) takes a perverse detour from family life by vanishing without a trace. Hidden in the attic of his carriage house garage and surviving by scavenging at night, Howard secretly observes the lives of his wife (Jennifer Garner) and children and neighbors. He slowly realizes that he has not left his family, he has left himself.

programme.title: Margin Call
programme.desc: Set in the high-stakes world of the ﬁnancial industry, this film follows the key players at an investment ﬁrm during a 24-hour period in the early stages of the 2008 ﬁnancial crisis. When an entry-level analyst unlocks information that could prove to be the downfall of the ﬁrm, a roller-coaster ride ensues as decisions both ﬁnancial and moral catapult the lives of all involved into mayhem.

programme.title: Shanghai Noon
programme.desc: The Wild West meets the Far East in a battle for honor, royalty and gold when acrobatic Chinese Imperial Guard Chon Wang (Jackie Chan) comes to America to rescue beautiful Princess Pei Pei (Lucy Liu) who has been kidnapped from The Forbidden City. With the help of a partner he doesn't trust (Owen Wilson), a wife he didn't expect (Brandon Merrill), a horse with a personality all its own and martial arts moves no one can believe, Chon finds himself facing the meanest gunslingers in the West.

programme.title: Robocop
programme.desc: When an honest cop (Peter Weller) is killed in the line of duty, the embattled Detroit Police Department of the future brings him back to life as RoboCop, the latest in cyborg technology. Programmed to be the ultimate law enforcer, RoboCop's not supposed to remember his human past - but memories of life, love and family are flooding in, blurring the line between man and machine, even as RoboCop sweeps the streets of "scum." Nancy Allen, Kurtwood Smith and Ronny Cox costar in this sci-fi blockbuster.

programme.title: The Haunting
programme.desc: In the 1860's, Hugh Crain finances the construction of Hill House, then dies an unexplained death. Tales circulate that the mansion is haunted by evil spirits. 130 years later, Dr. David Marrow (Liam Neeson), long fascinated by the Hill House legend, brings three people there for what he tells them will be a study in sleep disorders. They're outwardly brave, but it soon becomes evident that Hill House's sinister reputation has all of them on edge. Catherine Zeta-Jones, Lili Taylor and Owen Wilson costar.

programme.title: Cloverfield
programme.desc: A group of friends venture deep into the streets of New York on a rescue mission during a rampaging monster attack.

programme.title: Stealth
programme.desc: In the future, the Navy has developed a fighter jet piloted by artificial intelligence. The jet is placed on an aircraft carrier in the Pacific, under the command of stern Capt. George Cummings (Sam Shepard). The Navy has also chosen three pilots for a new generation of stealth fighter-bombers, designed to instantly respond to sightings of terrorists anywhere in the world. When the computer develops a mind of its own, it's the humans who must stop it before it precipitates a nuclear war. Also starring Jessica Biel, Josh Lucas and Jamie Foxx.

programme.title: Collide
programme.desc: Casey, a young American backpacker in Germany, falls in love with Juliette, a fellow American traveling through Europe. She is diagnosed with a fatal disease, and Casey decides to steal from German gangster Hagen, in order to pay for the medical treatment which could save Juliette's life. Casey's heist doesn't go as planned and Hagen catches him. He manages to escape Hagen's men, steal one of Hagen's cars, and flee. Pursued across Germany, he races to save his own life and get to Juliette before Hagen's men get to her first.

programme.title: Bipolar Rock 'N' Roller
programme.desc: A raw and unflinching account of Mauro Ranallo's decades-long struggle with Bipolar Affective Disorder. The voice of WWE and Showtime Championship Boxing, Ranallo has called some of the biggest sports events in history - all the while fighting his own epic battles with mental health. Follow his journey as he combats the stigma behind mental health issues and sheds light on what it's like being at the top of the industry despite seemingly insurmountable odds.(c)

programme.title: Never Mind
programme.desc: At the Melrose family’s glorious house in the South of France, young Patrick has the run of the magical grounds. His father David rules with cruelty and his mother Eleanor has retreated into self medication and booze. Bravely imaginative and self-sufficient out of necessity, 9-year-old Patrick encounters the volatile lives of adults with fear. They are expecting guests for the weekend, but this afternoon is profoundly unlike other summer days, and the shocking events that precede the guests’ arrival tear Patrick's world in two.(c)

programme.title: Queen of the Desert
programme.desc: Gertrude Bell (Nicole Kidman) rejects the stifling rigidity of life in turn-of-the-century England, leaving it behind for a chance to travel to Tehran. She begins her lifelong adventure across the Arab world, a journey marked by danger, a passionate affair with a British officer (James Franco), and an encounter with the legendary T.E. Lawrence (Robert Pattinson).

programme.title: The Preacher's Wife
programme.desc: Denzel Washington stars as an angel named Dudley sent to Earth to help a minister's marriage (Courtney B. Vance) to his wife (Whitney Houston). Things take a twist when Dudley accidentally falls in love with her.

programme.title: A Dog's Purpose
programme.desc: A devoted dog (voiced by Josh Gad) finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he teaches to laugh and love. Also starring Dennis Quaid, Britt Robertson, K.J. Apa, Peggy Lipton and Pooch Hall.

programme.title: G.I. Jane
programme.desc: Demi Moore stars as gutsy Lieutenant O'Neil, the first woman ever given the opportunity to earn a place in the armed forces most highly skilled combat unit - the elite Navy SEALS. But the already brutal rigors of training camp turn into an unimaginable test of courage and determination once it becomes clear that no one - not powerful politicians, top military brass, or her male Navy SEAL teammates - wants her to succeed!

programme.title: Ghost in the Shell
programme.desc: In the near future, Major (Scarlett Johansson) is the first of her kind - a human saved from a terrible crash, who is cyber-enhanced to be a perfect soldier devoted to stopping the world's most dangerous criminals. Terrorism has reached a new level that includes the ability to hack into people's minds and control them, but Major is uniquely qualified to stop it. As she prepares to face a new enemy, Major discovers that she has been lied to: her life was not saved, it was stolen. Now she must figure out who created her.

programme.title: Icebreaker
programme.desc: Axe makes a bold play to secure capital from a controversial source. Taylor chafes against Axe’s recent moves. Chuck recruits the allies he needs to move forward with a new plan. Connerty seeks out a career opportunity.(c)

programme.title: Crimson Tide
programme.desc: In the midst of a global crisis, the USS Alabama receives an unconfirmed order to launch its nuclear missiles - signaling the start of World War III. The tension quickly rises as the sub's respected commander (Gene Hackman) and his brilliant executive officer (Denzel Washington) clash over the validity of their orders, battling each other for control of the sub. Also starring Viggo Mortensen and James Gandolfini.

programme.title: Bad News
programme.desc: In the grip of his addictions, Patrick Melrose must fly to New York to collect his father’s ashes. Over the course of a lost Manhattan weekend, Patrick’s remorseless search for satisfaction, haunted by old acquaintances and insistent inner voices, sends him into a nightmarish spiral, including a disastrous date with the girl of his dreams. Alone in his hotel room later that night, he pushes body and mind to the very edge – desperate to stay one step ahead of his rapidly encroaching past. Limited series premiere.(c)

programme.title: Bad Moms
programme.desc: Over-worked, over-committed and exhausted, Amy joins forces with two other stressed moms on a quest to liberate themselves from conventional responsibilities - going on a long overdue binge of freedom and fun that puts them on a collision course with the head of the PTA and her clique of perfect moms.

programme.title: Some Hope
programme.desc: Patrick reluctantly agrees to go to his first big social event since recovering. Together with his good friend Johnny Hall, he attends a glittering party in the English countryside hosted by former hippie Bridget – now married, titled and miserable – and attended by Princess Margaret as well as a number of Patrick's old flames. Amid a crowd of social dragonflies, Patrick searches for redemption and capacity for forgiveness, while confronting his past in a myriad of ways.(n)

programme.title: Get The Gringo
programme.desc: An already bad day for Driver is not getting any better. He makes a big haul of millions that would give him a nice summer vacation on easy street, but it goes south - literally. During a high-speed car chase with the US Border Patrol and a bleeding body in his back seat, Driver flips his car smashing through the border wall, tumbling violently, coming to a stop in Mexico. Apprehended by the Mexican authorities, he is sent to a hard-core prison where he enters the strange and dangerous world of "El Pueblito". Starring Mel Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Ghost in the Shell
programme.desc: In the near future, Major (Scarlett Johansson) is the first of her kind - a human saved from a terrible crash, who is cyber-enhanced to be a perfect soldier devoted to stopping the world's most dangerous criminals. Former New Jersey Governor Chris Christie discusses trying to govern during a PR crisis, Steve Brill hosts an Axios event on combatting fake news, and Steve Schmidt and Mark Fabiani, Bill Clinton's advisor during the Whitewater scandal, both weigh in on how this White House is managing crises.(n)

programme.title: Bad Grandmas
programme.desc: Senior citizens Mimi, Bobbi, Virginia and Coralee quietly live out their twilight years in Southern Missouri playing cards and baking cakes. Bobbi's son-in-law, Jim, cons her into losing her house and Mimi, the unofficial leader of the group, decides to take matters into her own hands. Things spin out of control when she confronts Jim and he accidentally gets killed in the altercation.(n)

programme.title: Before I Fall
programme.desc: Sam (Zoey Deutch) seems to have everything a teenage girl could want: popularity, a hot boyfriend, cool status, fun friends, loving family and seeming happiness. But beyond the superficial, Sam's life isn't so charmed. She is one of a clique of high school mean girls who make life hell for those who are different. When Sam is killed in a car accident, she is forced to relive her last day on Earth seven times in order to get things right. She attempts to make sense of what befell her and gain a better understanding of herself and others.(n)

programme.title: Apollo 13
programme.desc: When a fuel leak threatens to strand three astronauts in space, the ground crew and the mission team must struggle to avert catastrophe. The team's solutions are ingenious, led by Academy Award winner Tom Hanks. Directed by Academy Award winner Ron Howard, this is the gripping true story of the 1970's ill-fated moon voyage.(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
programme.desc: Captain Jack Sparrow has a blood debt to pay. He owes his soul to the ghastly Davy Jones unless he can cheat death - and eternal damnation - by seizing the fabled Dead Man's Chest. Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom and Keira Knightley star.(n)

programme.title: Their Brand is Crisis
programme.desc: The Trump administration has had to contend with an unprecedented number of crises, and spinning them is an ongoing preoccupation. In this era of splintered news media, how do you get the right message to the right people, and still stay on course? Former New Jersey Governor Chris Christie discusses trying to govern during a PR crisis, Steve Brill hosts an Axios event on combatting fake news, and Steve Schmidt and Mark Fabiani, Bill Clinton's advisor during the Whitewater scandal, both weigh in on how this White House is managing crises.(n)

Together with his good friend Johnny Hall, he attends a glittering party in the English countryside hosted by former hippie Bridget – now married, titled and miserable – and attended by Princess Margaret as well as a number of Patrick's old flames. Amid a crowd of social dragonflies, Patrick searches for redemption and capacity for forgiveness, while confronting his past in a myriad of ways.(n)

programme.title: First 100 Days
programme.desc: As Donald Trump takes the oath of office, The New York Times’ New York and Washington bureaus prepare to cover an administration unlike any other. The role that Russia played in the 2016 election quickly emerges as a storyline that will continue to unfold. In this fiercely competitive environment, The Times and The Washington Post vie for scoops while overtaxed journalists work to develop sources inside a volatile administration. Meanwhile, the paper faces economic challenges as it continues to adapt to a digital world.(n)

programme.title: Maniac
programme.desc: Frank (Elijah Wood) is the withdrawn owner of a mannequin store, whose life changes when young artist Anna appears asking for his help with her new exhibition. As their friendship develops, Frank's obsession escalates and the number of victims increases. It becomes clear to Anna that Frank is far more dangerous than he seems.

programme.title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe
programme.desc: Coroner Tommy Tilden and son Austin run a morgue and crematorium in Virginia. When the local sheriff brings in a body found in the basement of a home, it seems like just another open-and-shut case. As the autopsy proceeds however, they are left reeling as the inspection brings new revelations. Perfectly preserved on the outside, Jane Doe seems to have been the victim of a horrific ritualistic torture. Tommy and Austin begin to piece together these gruesome discoveries, as an unnatural force takes hold of the crematorium.

programme.title: Survival Island
programme.desc: A shipwreck at sea leaves a wealthy married couple (Billy Zane and Kelly Brook) alive with only each other and a former servant (Juan Pablo di Pace) for companionship - a situation that quickly leads to sexual jealousy and murderous intentions.

programme.title: Dude Bro Party Massacre III
programme.desc: Brent enters the halls of the Delta Bi Theta fraternity. He isn't just any pledge, he's a legacy - and it's a legacy of death. Brent is actually there to solve the mystery of his identical twin brother Brock's murder, and he'll do anything to crack the case, including an attempt at the frat's most daring prank of all time. After the prank causes two commercial jets to collide over an orphanage, they're punished to a weekend at The Old Sorority House by the Lake. But they're not the only ones there, a killer named Motherface lurks nearby.

programme.title: I Survived a Zombie Holocaust
programme.desc: Fresh from film school, an enthusiastic young runner starts work on a low budget zombie movie only to run into the first day from hell as a mystery illness starts to turn the extras on set into the bona fide undead.

programme.title: The Bye Bye Man
programme.desc: Elliot, his girlfriend Sasha, and their friend John move into an old house off campus for their last year in college. Almost immediately, Sasha begins to suspect there is something wrong with the home, and enlists her clairvoyant friend Kim to hold a séance. Prompted by a clue in the house, they attract the attention of The Bye Bye Man, an insidious supernatural figure who deceives and preys upon his victims before causing them to turn on those around them.

programme.title: Personal Shopper
programme.desc: By day, American in Paris Maureen (Kristen Stewart) works as a personal shopper, motor-biking around the city buying up deluxe couture for a celebrity client. By night, she attempts to channel the spirits of the dead, hoping to make contact with her recently deceased twin brother. When Maureen begins receiving a series of chilling, increasingly sinister text messages, it seems she may have made contact - but she doesn't know with whom.

programme.title: Push (2009)
programme.desc: A clairvoyant teenager (Dakota Fanning) and a telekinetic fugitive (Chris Evans) team up to find a missing woman who is the key to exposing a sinister, secret government agency that's building a clandestine army of psychic warriors. Djimon Hounsou costars in this sci-fi action thriller.

programme.title: Wristcutters: A Love Story (2006)
programme.desc: After breaking up with his girlfriend, a young man decides to end it all, only to discover a run-down afterlife that is strikingly similar to his old one. When he discovers his ex-girlfriend is there too, he sets out on an absurd road trip through purgatory to find her.

programme.title: Don't Knock Twice
programme.desc: A successful sculptor named Jess returns to the UK to rebuild her relationship with Chloe, the daughter she was forced to give up nine years ago. When she agrees to come and live with her, Jess learns that Chloe has not come to stay because she wants to get to know her mother again. She has come because she is scared that a supernatural curse has claimed the life of her boyfriend, Danny, and is now coming for her. Chloe and Danny made the mistake of visiting an abandoned house once home to a witch, that comes for you if you knock on the door.

programme.title: Reeker
programme.desc: A group of disparate strangers including a blind genius and a druggie who ripped off his ecstasy dealer converges on a small, abandoned town where they are promptly slaughtered one at a time by a grotesque and extremely foul-smelling creature. Devon Gummersall, Derek Richardson and Tina Illman star in this tongue-in-cheek horror flick.

programme.title: The Hills Have Eyes
programme.desc: Directed by Wes Craven, this cult horror classic is the tale of an all-American family on a road trip to California when their car breaks down in the remote southwestern desert, and they encounter a clan of marauding, inbred cannibals. In this primal wasteland, will the innocent turn savage to survive?

programme.title: Push (2009)
programme.desc: A clairvoyant teenager (Dakota Fanning) and a telekinetic fugitive (Chris Evans) team up to find a missing woman who is the key to exposing a sinister, secret government agency that's building a clandestine army of psychic warriors. Djimon Hounsou costars in this sci-fi action thriller.

programme.title: Open Water
programme.desc: Loosely inspired by a shocking true story, this chilling psychological horror story follows a bickering couple on vacation in the Caribbean who are accidentally abandoned during a diving expedition and forced to fend for themselves in the ocean as they are surrounded by sharks - while the tour operators back at the harbor take 24 hours to realize that they have left a pair of customers stranded. Blanchard Ryan and Daniel Travis star in this gripping independent hit from writer/director Chris Kentis.

programme.title: Personal Shopper
programme.desc: By day, American in Paris Maureen (Kristen Stewart) works as a personal shopper, motor-biking around the city buying up deluxe couture for a celebrity client. By night, she attempts to channel the spirits of the dead, hoping to make contact with her recently deceased twin brother. When Maureen begins receiving a series of chilling, increasingly sinister text messages, it seems she may have made contact - but she doesn't know with whom.

programme.title: The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus
programme.desc: Doctor Parnassus (Christopher Plummer) is cursed with a dark secret. Thousands of years ago he made a bet with the devil, Mr. Nick (Tom Waits), in which he won immortality. Centuries later, on meeting his one true love, Dr. Parnassus made another deal with the devil, trading his immortality for youth, on condition that when his daughter reaches her 16th birthday, she will become the property of Mr. Nick. His daughter is now rapidly approaching the age milestone and Dr. Parnassus is desperate to protect her from her impending fate.

programme.title: Single White Female 2: The Psycho
programme.desc: When Holly Parker (Kristen Miller) moves into her new apartment, she thinks she has found the perfect roommate: Tess Kositch (Allison Lange), a sweet and shy young woman who wants to be her friend. But underneath Tess' shy exterior lies a killer who believes there is nothing sweeter in life than murdering a friend in pain. And Holly is feeling a lot of pain lately, what with her boyfriend cheating on her and her co-worker undermining any chance she has for promotion. But Holly need not worry, Tess will take care of her.

programme.title: Zombie Honeymoon
programme.desc: When a beach-front encounter with a zombie during their honeymoon results in a groom with a taste for human flesh, a newlywed bride tries to make the best of a rapidly deteriorating situation in this romantic horror comedy starring Tracy Coogan and Graham Sibley.

programme.title: Death Do Us Part
programme.desc: An engaged couple goes away with their friends to a remote cabin to celebrate their upcoming wedding but the weekend takes a horrifying turn when dark secrets and forbidden desires are revealed and what started as a celebration quickly descends into a bloody nightmare.

programme.title: The Imaginarium of Doctor Parnassus
programme.desc: Doctor Parnassus (Christopher Plummer) is cursed with a dark secret. Thousands of years ago he made a bet with the devil, Mr. Nick (Tom Waits), in which he won immortality. Centuries later, on meeting his one true love, Dr. Parnassus made another deal with the devil, trading his immortality for youth, on condition that when his daughter reaches her 16th birthday, she will become the property of Mr. Nick. His daughter is now rapidly approaching the age milestone and Dr. Parnassus is desperate to protect her from her impending fate.

programme.title: Don't Sleep
programme.desc: Shawn and Zach are young lovers who move into a guesthouse together on an estate owned by Mr. and Mrs. Marino. When bizarre events begin to occur, Zach slowly remembers a forgotten time in his childhood when he suffered from severe and violent psychosis - memories erased by a series of electroconvulsive shock treatments administered by his psychiatrist. As the terrors surrounding their lives grow to deadly proportions, Zach is forced to question his own sanity.

programme.title: Max Steel
programme.desc: Teenager Max McGrath moves back to Copper Canyon, the town where his scientist father died under mysterious circumstances. Adjusting to a new school is not easy for Max, and it becomes even more complicated when his body starts to generate strange energy flare-ups that he can't control. This unpredictable power surge grows too intense for Max to handle and he is forced to distance himself from those around him. On the brink of fatal combustion, Max is rescued by Steel, an extraterrestrial who has been secretly monitoring his progress.

programme.title: Dream House
programme.desc: Daniel Craig and Academy Award winner Rachel Weisz star as a couple that unknowingly moves into a New England home where several grisly murders were committed, only to become the killer's next target. Academy Award nominee Naomi Watts stars as a neighbor who knew the previous family - a family whose gruesome story could be horrific foreshadowing of the present family's demise. Directed by the Academy Award nominee Jim Sheridan.

programme.title: ATM
programme.desc: After leaving a party together, coworkers David (Brian Geraghty), Emily (Alice Eve) and Corey (Josh Peck) stop at an ATM. Pulling into a desolate parking lot, Corey gets out to get cash and a routine transaction turns into a struggle for survival when an unknown man appears outside blocking their exit. With the wintry temperatures dipping below freezing, and the morning sunrise still hours away, they have no choice but to play the man's deadly game of cat-and-mouse.

programme.title: Cell
programme.desc: At the Boston airport, Clay (John Cusack) witnesses a scene of chaotic mayhem when an electronic signal turns hundreds of cell phone users into rabid killers. Desperate to find his estranged wife and son, Clay teams with a train driver (Samuel L. Jackson) to battle the horde of murderous phoners as the city descends into madness.

programme.title: Attack of the Killer Donuts
programme.desc: A chemical accident turns ordinary donuts into bloodthirsty monsters and three friends must track them down as they begin eating their victims. It's up to them to destroy the donuts and save their sleepy little town.

programme.title: Intruders
programme.desc: An agoraphobic woman is isolated from human contact in every way and that is exactly how she likes it. But when a trio of criminals breaks into her old Victorian house on the outskirts of town, they discover there's another side to her psychosis.

programme.title: Skybound
programme.desc: Five plane passengers are unable to land after a gigantic disaster happens on the ground.

programme.title: Dream House
programme.desc: Daniel Craig and Academy Award winner Rachel Weisz star as a couple that unknowingly moves into a New England home where several grisly murders were committed, only to become the killer's next target. Academy Award nominee Naomi Watts stars as a neighbor who knew the previous family - a family whose gruesome story could be horrific foreshadowing of the present family's demise. Directed by the Academy Award nominee Jim Sheridan.

programme.title: Attack of the Killer Donuts
programme.desc: A chemical accident turns ordinary donuts into bloodthirsty monsters and three friends must track them down as they begin eating their victims. It's up to them to destroy the donuts and save their sleepy little town.(n)

programme.title: Cell
programme.desc: At the Boston airport, Clay (John Cusack) witnesses a scene of chaotic mayhem when an electronic signal turns hundreds of cell phone users into rabid killers. Desperate to find his estranged wife and son, Clay teams with a train driver (Samuel L. Jackson) to battle the horde of murderous phoners as the city descends into madness.(n)

programme.title: Don't Sleep
programme.desc: Shawn and Zach are young lovers who move into a guesthouse together on an estate owned by Mr. and Mrs. Marino. When bizarre events begin to occur, Zach slowly remembers a forgotten time in his childhood when he suffered from severe and violent psychosis - memories erased by a series of electroconvulsive shock treatments administered by his psychiatrist. As the terrors surrounding their lives grow to deadly proportions, Zach is forced to question his own sanity.(n)

programme.title: It Stains The Sands Red
programme.desc: In the throes of a zombie apocalypse, Molly - a troubled woman from Las Vegas with a dark past - finds herself stranded in the desert with a ravenous zombie on her tail. At first, she's easily able to outpace her undead pursuer, but things quickly become worse when she realizes the zombie doesn't need to ever stop and rest. Running low on supplies and beat down by the harsh environment, Molly must summon strength she never knew she had in order to face it.(n)

programme.title: Nocturne
